alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 1:55PM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over exposed and open terrain. Patchy blowing snow remains possible. * WHERE...Elevations above 4500 feet in Klamath Basin and Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. This includes much of highways 97 and 140. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will increase from 2500 feet Thursday night up to 5500 feet Saturday. A few inches of snow are expected in the valleys Friday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
